<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[93, 277, 322, 293]]<|/det|>
## FURTHER MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[832, 277, 904, 293]]<|/det|>
9231/21  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 301, 367, 316]]<|/det|>
Paper 2 Further Pure Mathematics 2  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[780, 302, 904, 316]]<|/det|>
May/June 2025  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[840, 326, 904, 340]]<|/det|>
2 hours  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[93, 355, 393, 370]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the question paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[93, 384, 392, 399]]<|/det|>
You will need: List of formulae (MF19)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 418, 221, 432]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 434, 880, 636]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown.- You should use a calculator where appropriate.- You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.- Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 665, 212, 678]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 681, 728, 712]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 75.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 77, 99, 94]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[109, 76, 918, 110]]<|/det|>
1 Find the roots of the equation \(z^{3}=27-27 \mathrm{i}\), giving your answers in the form \(r \mathrm{e}^{\mathrm{i} \theta}\), where \(r>0\) and \(-\pi \leqslant \theta<\pi\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 77, 99, 94]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[109, 71, 611, 102]]<|/det|>
2 Let \(I_{n}=\int_{0}^{1}\left(1-x\right)^{n} \sinh x \mathrm{~d} x\), where \(n\) is a non-negative integer.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 110, 144, 127]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 108, 522, 128]]<|/det|>
(a) Show that, for \(n \geqslant 2, \quad I_{n}=-1+n(n-1) I_{n-2}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 603, 144, 619]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 602, 366, 621]]<|/det|>
(b) Find the exact value of \(I_{2}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 83, 99, 100]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[109, 76, 918, 119]]<|/det|>
3 By considering the binomial expansion of \(\left(z-\frac{1}{z}\right)^{5}\), where \(z=\cos \theta+\mathrm{i} \sin \theta\), use de Moivre's theorem to show that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[356, 140, 643, 170]]<|/det|>
\[
\cos \mathrm{e}^{5} \theta=\frac{a}{\sin 5 \theta+b \sin 3 \theta+c \sin \theta}
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 192, 484, 209]]<|/det|>
where \(a, b\) and \(c\) are integers to be determined.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 72, 99, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[109, 71, 97, 88]]<|/det|>
4

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[109, 91, 880, 505]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 515, 918, 555]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows the curve with equation \(y=\frac{1}{\sqrt{x}} \mathrm{e}^{\sqrt{x}}\) for \(x \geqslant 1\), together with a set of \(n-1\) rectangles of unit width.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 567, 144, 584]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 567, 672, 585]]<|/det|>
(a) By considering the sum of the areas of these rectangles, show that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[371, 600, 625, 644]]<|/det|>
\[
\sum_{r=1}^{n} \frac{1}{\sqrt{r}} \mathrm{e}^{\sqrt{r}}<\left(2+\frac{1}{\sqrt{n}}\right) \mathrm{e}^{\sqrt{n}}-2 \mathrm{e} .
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[892, 615, 918, 632]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 259, 144, 275]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 247, 730, 288]]<|/det|>
(b) Use a similar method to find, in terms of \(n\), a lower bound for \(\sum_{r=1}^{n} \frac{1}{\sqrt{r}} \mathrm{e}^{\sqrt{r}}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 72, 99, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[109, 74, 544, 91]]<|/det|>
5 Find the particular solution of the differential equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[403, 108, 594, 145]]<|/det|>
\[
6 \frac{\mathrm{d}^{2} x}{\mathrm{~d} t^{2}}+3 \frac{\mathrm{~d} x}{\mathrm{~d} t}+6 x=\mathrm{e}^{-t}
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 161, 400, 190]]<|/det|>
given that, when \(t=0, x=\frac{\mathrm{d} x}{\mathrm{~d} t}=0\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 72, 99, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 76, 144, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 74, 791, 91]]<|/det|>
6 (a) Starting from the definitions of tanh and sech in terms of exponentials, prove that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[415, 102, 583, 122]]<|/det|>
\[
1-\tanh ^{2} u=\operatorname{sech}^{2} u
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 521, 144, 538]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 515, 443, 548]]<|/det|>
(b) Show that \(\frac{\mathrm{d}}{\mathrm{d} t}(\operatorname{sech}^{-1} t)=-\frac{1}{t \sqrt{1-t^{2}}}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 74, 235, 90]]<|/det|>
<pre>It is given that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[282, 101, 717, 123]]<|/det|>
<pre>\[
x=\tanh ^{-1} t \quad \text { and } \quad y=t \operatorname{sech}^{-1} t, \quad \text { for } 0<t<1
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 152, 144, 168]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 144, 495, 173]]<|/det|>
(c) Show that \(\frac{\mathrm{d} y}{\mathrm{~d} x}=-\sqrt{1-t^{2}}+\left(1-t^{2}\right) \operatorname{sech}^{-1} t\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 460, 144, 476]]<|/det|>
<label>(d)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 448, 337, 485]]<|/det|>
(d) Find \(\frac{\mathrm{d}^{2} y}{\mathrm{~d} x^{2}}\) in terms of \(t\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 72, 99, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[109, 74, 465, 91]]<|/det|>
7 Find the solution of the differential equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[396, 109, 601, 147]]<|/det|>
\[
\frac{\mathrm{d} y}{\mathrm{~d} x}-\frac{x+5}{x^{2}+10 x+61} y=1
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 165, 630, 183]]<|/det|>
given that \(y=0\) when \(x=3\). Give your answer in an exact form.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 75, 99, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>8</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 78, 144, 95]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 76, 918, 108]]<|/det|>
8 (a) It is given that \(\lambda\) is an eigenvalue of the non-singular square matrix \(\mathbf{A}\), with corresponding eigenvector \(\mathbf{e}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[157, 120, 714, 140]]<|/det|>
Show that \(\mathbf{e}\) is an eigenvector of \(\mathbf{A}^{3}\) with corresponding eigenvalue \(\lambda^{3}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 400, 317, 417]]<|/det|>
<pre>The matrix \(\mathbf{A}\) is given by

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[425, 425, 576, 483]]<|/det|>
<pre>\[
\mathbf{A}=\left(\begin{array}{rrr}
-1 & 3 & 4 \\
0 & 1 & 0 \\
0 & -2 & 5
\end{array}\right)
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 508, 144, 525]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 507, 532, 524]]<|/det|>
(b) Show that the eigenvalues of \(\mathbf{A}\) are \(-1,1\) and 5 .

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 79, 144, 96]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 76, 688, 97]]<|/det|>
(c) Find a matrix \(\mathbf{P}\) and a diagonal matrix \(\mathbf{D}\) such that \(\mathbf{A}-2 \mathbf{I}=\mathbf{P D P}^{-1}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 573, 144, 590]]<|/det|>
<label>(d)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 570, 918, 604]]<|/det|>
(d) Use the characteristic equation of \(\mathbf{A}\) to show that \((\mathbf{A}-2 \mathbf{I})^{3}=a \mathbf{A}^{2}+b \mathbf{A}+c \mathbf{I}\) where \(a, b\) and \(c\) are constants to be determined.

<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[432, 72, 567, 88]]<|/det|>
